body.name: Pimax Portal Handheld Game Console with 4K 120Hz Display, Gaming Console for Android, Retro Video Games, Cloud Gaming, Handheld Emulator, 8G+256G, Black
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Thursday, February 15. Order within 9 hrs 18 mins
Or fastest pickup Thursday, February 15. Order within 9 hrs 18 mins
features: Stunning Visuals - With its 4K display and 120Hz refresh rate, Portal sets a new standard for breathtaking visuals. Also in virtual reality mode, players are also fully immersed in realistic worlds, pushing the boundaries of traditional gaming, even retro games can also be lifted by this feature.
Plays Literally Any Game - Not only millions of Android games, but also support Retro Game, Cloud Game, Android Game and even VR games (Coming soon).

Impressive Performance - Outstanding 3D Mark scores in the field of handheld emulator. Powered by a Snapdragon 865 equivalent processor and active cooling, the Pimax Portal delivers a gaming experience like no other.

Dual Magnetic Controllers - Custom key mapping, magnetic Controllers with 32 Physic buttons and inbuilt linear trigger for real in-game feedback. Take off the controllers and play from a distance, or snap them to the main body. The controllers connect with metal pins so there's zero latency loss.

Smooth Streaming Experience - Use this gaming console to remotely play your favorite video games of your current devices through the Xbox Remote Play app or Steam Link app, diving into the distinctive game experience with 4K resolution.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 19, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars So much potential.
reviews.reviewText: Wanted this console since playing with it at CES. The idea of the ultimate convergence device was amazing. Unfortunately the execution fell a bit short. A year in and still no VR headset for it. Also this does not run an approved version of android, while having play store support, not all apps will run on the portal. Another annoyance is that the Portal has a DRM issue and will not play any streaming movies from streaming services like Netflix, Disney+, Hulu, etc. Even movies anywhere will only play with sound only. Too many issues with such an expensive android gaming device. Had to return it unfortunately.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 31, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Superb device for retro gaming
reviews.reviewText: I own several emulation handhelds at this point. The Pimax Portal stands out as one of the most unique devices in my collection. It's also just plain fun to play around with.What makes the Portal special? For one, the raw oomph. As of August 2023, this is top tier among Android handhelds that are suitable for emulation. (Some newer phones will outperform the Portal, but most of these have aspect ratios that are less than ideal for emulating older consoles.) Of course there are new consoles released seemingly every week, and the Portal will surely be surpassed in power sooner rather than later.That's OK, because power isn't all the Portal has going for it. It's a handheld that, despite the unmistakeable influence of the Nintendo Switch, manages to feel inspired in its own right. Other handhelds have done detachable controllers, but Pimax's magnetic holsters are a neat take on the concept; it's remarkable how satisfying it is to hear the click as the magnets snap the controllers back into place A 4K screen is overkill for emulating retro games but is darn pleasant to have around for general Android usage. There's also a micro-HDMI *in* port on the QLED version enabling the Portal to be used as a tiny external monitor, should you be inclined in that direction. Most importantly ... in just another couple of months, Pimax will be releasing a VR headset that allows you to turn the Portal into an Oculus Quest competitor. It's a brilliantly versatile device.That said, the Portal isn't perfect. The build of Android 10 it ships with is a little too locked down for my tastes. Things have gotten better as of a week or so ago; Pimax now lets users set a custom launcher. But there are still some peculiarities. For example, the familiar notification area Android users expect when swiping from the top of the screen is nowhere to be found. This means it's impossible to check on the status of your downloads in Firefox, for example. Hopefully these quirks get ironed out over the coming months.Despite these niggles, I have no qualms recommending the Portal to people who can afford the (admittedly) luxury price tag. It's an amazing tech toy.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This product is great highly recommend.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 6, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Overall bad product
reviews.reviewText: 144hz in description - only 120hz, no option for 144hz.No VR as it was advertised, yet (software is not ready, headset as well) I doubt it ever will.Product is $600 before tax and button prints are misaligned.Default launcher is awful, clunky, glitchy. Problems with read/write speed on SD card after update. Which could be improved in the future.Overall, I would really love this thing to succeed, but I don't see a way considering the stage of the product and that it's already selling for this price

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 26, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Screen has problems battery life is like 1.5 hours play gets really hot if you put it down

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Pimax lies to customers. They keep posting a picture of a white console having led glowrings around joysticks but in fact, only the most expensive black QLED version has these. All other lower cost version DO NOT have glowing joysticks!Pimax refuses to update the Android version, and never made the extra buttons on top of joysticks functional.The ergonomics of the console are terrible. My thumbs hurt when I play. Joysticks are very imprecise, very hard to make fine movements.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best Portable Gaming System
reviews.reviewText: I Bought this product for my daughter who likes to play on the go. We often drive to LA and back. I bought it for the reason and I can say it’s a great product. It looks and feels like a high end gaming console on the go. I would recommend this!!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars I'm pretty impressed
reviews.reviewText: I would have given it 5 stars but the VR mode is not available yet. This thing does literally everything and I am impressed by the technology. I play emulator games and literally have stopped using my Nintendo Switch. I definitely recommend it for a handheld and will update my review when VR mode is finally available.Battery life may need some optimization and I get about two hours of life. TheThe QLED screen is crisp and clear.The controllers are definitely fun and it's pretty comfortable minus the the tear drop buttons which are kind of sharp.It's weight is really nice and not noticeable.This thing does heat up pretty decently but does not burn me.
